triples.evidence: A transistor takes a small signal at its input and produces a much larger version of the same signal shape at its output - it acts as an amplifier.
If we combine two diodes in a specific configuration, we create a transistor.
By connecting logic gates, we can create circuits that add, multiply, store data, and make decisions - the very basis of digital computers.

concepts.term: a transistor takes a small signal at its input and produces a much larger version of the same signal shape at its output

evidence: A transistor takes a small signal at its input and produces a much larger version of the same signal shape at its output - it acts as an amplifier. This ability to magnify weak signals makes the transistor an essential building block for electronics.
